title: El Triunfo, Ecuador
text:
El Triunfo (<a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a> for "<a href="The%20Triumph%20%28disambiguation%29">The Triumph</a>"), formerly known as Boca de los Sapos (<a href="Frog">Frog</a>s' <a href="cove">cove</a>), is a <a href="town">town</a> located in <a href="Guayas%20Province">Guayas</a>, <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>, near the <a href="Ca%C3%B1ar%20Province">Cañar province</a>. It is the <a href="Canton%20seat">seat</a> of <a href="El%20Triunfo%20Canton">El Triunfo Canton</a>, created in 1983.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2001, there are 34,117 people residing within canton limits. The area of the canton is 468.8 km², but some of it is disputed with <a href="La%20Troncal">La Troncal</a> Canton in <a href="Ca%C3%B1ar%20Province">Cañar</a>.
French <a href="priest">priest</a> Luis López Lescure helped the town grow. It is the most important town in <a href="east">east</a>ern Guayas, as it grew around a <a href="road%20junction">road junction</a>.
